title: Spiced Buttermilk | Talimpu Majjiga 👌| South Indian Style 🥛
content:
In India 🇮🇳 summer plays a vital role, Kids are enjoying their holidays, family tours, Homemakers are enthusiastic to make pickles, Students awaiting for examination results, Businessman are busy with their work, so everyone involved in any of these activities or tasks. To enjoy the holidays or do any routine work during summer is a bit harder than the other seasons. Because due to heat in summer,it makes us sick or tired or irritate you sometimes. To get rid of all these tensions, you need to drink plenty of water or healthy drinks or fresh juices or you can also make Buttermilk at home 🏡 'Buttermilk' is a liquid substance leftover after churning cultured cream. We call it 'Majjiga', this is healthy natural drink available at home. It gives you relief in hot summer and maintains your body not to dehydrate. They're various benefits from Buttermilk, in south India it's our daily sip at the end of lunch or dinner. It's traditional and delicious 😋 Today, I'm sharing spiced Buttermilk which is require in this hot summer ☀️ Let's start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Curd / Yogurt - 200 ml
  • Water - 500 ml
  • Salt - 1 tsp
For tempering:
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Curry leaves - 8
  • Green chilly - 1 - finely chopped
  • Hing/ Asafoetida/ Inguva - 1/4 tsp
  • Oil - 1 tsp
Procedure: Pre-preparation:
  • In a large bowl add curd and water
  • Give it a whisk or add in juicer to make thin and lump free Buttermilk
  • Buttermilk is ready, keep aside
Process of making Spiced Buttermilk:
  • Heat tempering pan over medium heat
  • Add oil, mustard seeds , cumin seeds, chopped green chilly , curry leaves
  • Turn off heat and add hing, Saute and add in butter milk
  • Add salt and mix well
  • Talimpu Majjiga is ready to serve
  • Happy cooking 👩🏻‍🍳 & Have a lovely day 😊
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust spices according to taste
  • While serving, You can also include chopped cilantro
  • If you don't have curd/ yogurt at home, you can use store bought curd
